intro: Nitrosalsola damascena, commonly known as the Damascena nitrosalsola, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
